attributes.comment:
I believe that the proposed increases in fees for adoption are unreasonable and
unbearable by many adoptive families. The fees for adoption should be held at
their current level because, for many of us, we have to file TWICE since the
approval is only good for 18 months. With adoptions taking longer and longer,
most of us have to file twice, paying the FULL PRICE again for services that were
initially invalid by the time the adoption finally happens.

As I understand it, the fee for the I600A will go from $545 to $670, which is an
excessive, and most families have to pay this twice. Fingerprinting fees are
supposed to be increased as well.

As if that weren't enough, applying for the children?s Certificate of Citizenship (for
IR4 visas) is proposed to increase from $215 to $460, a difference of $245 or a
whopping 120% increase! As hopeful adoptive parents, I can attest that we
cannot afford these increases, and I respectfully submit that they do not reflect
anything even vaguely resembling the inflation rate.

My wife and I beg you to reconsider, for our sake and the sake of the children who
so desperately need good homes.

Thank you for you consideration,
Patrick Lonowski
Claudia Lonowski-Munoz
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Patrick Lonowski
